# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

```julia
function wrap_string(s; text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s)
    lines = String[]
    current_line = ""

    for word in words
        if length(current_line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)
            current_line = word
        else
            if !isempty(current_line)
                current_line *= " "
            end
            current_line *= word
        end
    end

    push!(lines, current_line)
    return join(lines, "\n")
end

# Example usage:
println(wrap_string("This is a very long string that needs to be wrapped.", text_width=20))
```
